title: QUIC: Missing implementation of SocketQUICStream_event_string()
body:
## Summary

The function `SocketQUICStream_event_string()` is declared in the header file but not implemented in the source file.

## Details

- **File**: `src/quic/SocketQUICStream.c`
- **Header Declaration**: `include/quic/SocketQUICStream.h:498`
- **Severity**: CRITICAL
- **Pattern**: MISSING_IMPLEMENTATION

## Impact

Any code attempting to call `SocketQUICStream_event_string()` for debugging or logging will fail at link time with an undefined reference error.

## Expected Implementation

Based on the header documentation (line 491-498), this function should return a human-readable string representation of a `SocketQUICStreamEvent`.

## Recommended Fix

Add implementation to `src/quic/SocketQUICStream.c`:

```c
static const char *event_strings[] = {
  [QUIC_STREAM_EVENT_SEND_DATA] = "Send Data",
  [QUIC_STREAM_EVENT_SEND_FIN] = "Send FIN",
  [QUIC_STREAM_EVENT_ALL_DATA_ACKED] = "All Data Acked",
  [QUIC_STREAM_EVENT_SEND_RESET] = "Send Reset",
  [QUIC_STREAM_EVENT_RESET_ACKED] = "Reset Acked",
  [QUIC_STREAM_EVENT_RECV_DATA] = "Receive Data",
  [QUIC_STREAM_EVENT_RECV_FIN] = "Receive FIN",
  [QUIC_STREAM_EVENT_ALL_DATA_RECVD] = "All Data Received",
  [QUIC_STREAM_EVENT_APP_READ_DATA] = "App Read Data",
  [QUIC_STREAM_EVENT_RECV_RESET] = "Receive Reset",
  [QUIC_STREAM_EVENT_APP_READ_RESET] = "App Read Reset",
  [QUIC_STREAM_EVENT_RECV_STOP_SENDING] = "Receive Stop Sending"
};

const char *
SocketQUICStream_event_string (SocketQUICStreamEvent event)
{
  if (event < 0 || event > QUIC_STREAM_EVENT_MAX)
    return "Unknown";
  return event_strings[event];
}
```

## References

- RFC 9000 Section 3 (Stream States and Events)
- Related: Similar pattern used for `type_strings` and `state_strings` in the same file
